title: How can someone gain knowledge and wisdom even if they’re young? - Quora

response.answer_text: I'm a man from Europe. And I am a bit older. I think you should set yourself goals. And check these goals. What is possible? What should I do? What can I do? And ask you these questions. And these questions if it goes handwritten every day write. Here comes another text from the radio. They have described exactly what wisdom is. Good luck. Wisdom - The art of wise living Author and director: Dorit Kreissl "60 years and not a bit wise," sang Curd Jürgens once. He was right, because the widespread view that "age makes wise" is fundamentally wrong. Wisdom is multidimensional, based on knowledge, experience, judgment, values and emotion control. The supreme discipline around wisdom, the highest goal that a person can achieve, was philosophy, which already bears the "love of wisdom" in its name. Today the question of a successful life is scientifically investigated and answered less by philosophers than by psychologists. The "Berlin Model of Wisdom" was created as early as the 1980s. The psychologists developed empirical models to investigate general and personal wisdom. For the latter, they established five criteria, five skills, on the basis of which the wisdom level of the test subjects was assessed: They tested factual knowledge, practical knowledge and strategies for making decisions, coping with difficult life problems, thinking in contexts as well as the ability to tolerate and affirm universal values. Age Wisdom - Dealing with the Time Remaining Author: Mechthild Müser / Director: Eva Demmelhuber Ageing requires courage - because losses increase with age, because physical limits are shown, because one loses abilities and friends. This is humiliating in a society where youth and performance are at the forefront, and can have devastating effects on the well-being of the elderly, especially as nothing has prepared them for aging. The end of life, a true vale of tears? It doesn't have to be that way. Those who turn their attention to what they still have instead of what they have lost, who can appreciate the abundance of the past decades, feel grateful. Those who can assume that life is never as perfect as the glossy brochures suggest a happy existence are happier, because marriage and professional life are often only half successful and children go their own way. Looking with cheerfulness at one's own mistakes and still not remaining silent in the face of the misery and injustice in the world helps to get out of the circle around one's own state of mind. And thus also to win a piece of freedom for oneself.

Well done! Without intending to, your question has just recapitulated the introduction to the Book of Proverbs. “The proverbs of Solomon the son of David, king of Israel: To know wisdom and instruction, To discern the sayings of understanding. To receive instruction in wise behavior, Righteousness, justice and equity; To give prudence to the naive, To the youth knowledge and discretion, Proverbs 1:1–4 (NAS): Here are a coulple of proverbial statements that back this up: “a wise but young lad is better than an old but foolish king who has forgotten how to listen.” and “ I have more insight than all my teachers, For Your testimonies are my meditation. I understand more than the aged, Because I have observed Your precepts.” Wisdom is a gift from the all wise God—the younger that you are when you accept His gift the longer the blessing will be when you start to live wisely according to His Word.

Typically, people really only learn from their mistakes. Unfortunately, some don’t even do that. Understand that a mistake isn’t a mistake if you learn something from it. Then it is a lesson. Some of these lessons cost more than others. Don’t follow the herd. By that I mean don’t blindly do what everyone else is doing. These types of people aren’t paying attention and miss so many opportunities to gain knowledge. Wisdom is what you do with what you know. No one receives an answer unless they ask a question. Ask. Desire the truth rather than peoples opinions. Don’t create opinions that are not based on truth. If you are ever wrong, do not be offended by the person who points it out. A person who desires wisdom loves to be corrected. They would rather admit fault if that means in the end they have more truth. But if you are going to be corrected make sure the person correcting you is able to support their correction. When they do support it, thank them and consider them a friend.

knowledge and wisdom have no age , we can use our knowlege and wisdom in the pursuit of any goal we choose. knowleged is gained through experience(doesn’t mean age) , education, when one has a overall understanding of a subject in a general sense. wisdom is gained from having experiance, conducting your thoughts of judgement in a good manor, being wise in use of knowledge you have learned experienced and incorporate this with wisdom and you have empowered yourself, taught that you can express the qualities of knowledge and wisdom while continuing to contain and excell.

I don’t know. As someone who shed knowledge like water off a duck’s back when I was young, and can remember having no wisdom, only self-consciousness as a child, I am probably the wrong person to ask. But two things I wish for my daughter to keep in mind are that assumptions are trouble, andhonest, open, kind communication can solve most problems.Thanks for asking me to answer.

Listen to what people say and do. Evaluate those older than yourself, and try and decide why theyre like they are. Observation and book knowledge will help also. Be open minded to what you hear and read. You dont have to believe all of it but opening your mind to the possibility is the first step. A closed minded, stubborn person cant achieve wisdom, you must be able to evaluate and investigate everything your faced with in order to grow mentally.

Connected to past lives or simply a product of their environment or both. No man or woman could ever create such an in-tune being. AI could never achieve wisdom. This is the only time I'd be willing to suggest divine intervention is at play but from more of an earthly, shamanistic view, rather than a religious one.

By choosing to DO THE TRUTH YOU LEARN OR KNOW, instead of merely tossing it around in your head and mouth for yourself to think or talk about. Many benefits will derive from this. True wisdom always gives you things to do. False wisdom always gives you things to think about to keep you focused on your thinking processes and opinions and with learning to speak in a way that tries to portray an image of wisdom to others. Beware of this.

One can and must gain knowledge particularly when they are young, as otherwise it may be too late! But wisdom? That should grow in one by virtue of applying knowledge in the right way for the right purpose, by studying and emulating others whom the world has acknowledged as wise, and reflecting on one’s purpose and goals with a disciplined mind. Wisdom may not be a sudden revelation, but may come in small doses with deep experience. It is for others to recognise that one is wise. Best of luck! Prof Krishna 9 July 2019
By understanding your childhood and old age. By understanding your birth and death , where are you born and why did you born. When you see the whole picture you will be clear and clarity is wisdom.
